alert.note: Alert for Dawes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 8:41PM CDT until August 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: .A line of strong thunderstorms will remain nearly stationary west of Chadron this evening. Very heavy rainfall and large hail are expected with these thunderstorms will could lead to flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Dawes. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northwestern Dawes County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
